conclusion: Four identical blocks are on a smooth surface; blocks B and C are connected by a spring.
A force F is applied to block B, causing all blocks to accelerate with the same acceleration.
Assume each block has mass m and acceleration is a.
The force F is distributed among the blocks: F = 4m * a.
Static friction force on block D equals the force needed to accelerate it: F_static = m * a.
Since blocks are identical, mass of block D is m, so F_static = m * a.
Substitute a into F_static equation: F_static = F / 4.
Magnitude of static friction force on block D is F/4.
